isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER DIAGNOSTICS AND SERVICE - CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 MODELS

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to January 1991

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, or Tachometer Display Failure

svcsubproc.para: If any of the speedometer, odometer, or tachometer gauge displays is indicating a failure, the circuits serving the instrument in question must be checked for clean, tight, unbroken and non-shorted connections.

important.para: Be sure all relays in the vehicle are the suppressed type.
Make sure the accessory voltage to the cluster is within a range of 11 to 16 volts.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to table below for possible conditions and corrective actions.

entry.para: Condition
First Action
Second Action
1. With ignition key ON, the speedometer dial pointer is not at 0 to 1 MPH (Km/h)
Remove gauge and verify ignition voltage and ground are provided to the gauge. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Replace speedometer.
2. With ignition key ON, gauge dial pointer is at 0 to 1 MPH (Km/h), but speedometer does not work.
Remove gauge and verify ignition voltage and ground are provided to the gauge. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Check speedometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL. If OK, replace speedometer.
3. With ignition key ON, the tachometer dial pointer is not at 0 to 1 RPM.
Remove gauge and verify ignition voltage and ground are provided to the gauge. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Replace tachometer.
4. With ignition key ON, gauge dial pointer is at 0 to 1 RPM, but tachometer does not work.
Remove gauge and verify ignition voltage and ground are provided to the gauge. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Check tachometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL. If OK, replace tachometer.
5. Odometer does not work.
Replace speedometer.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 to June 1994

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, or Tachometer Display Failure

svcsubproc.para: If any of the speedometer, odometer, or tachometer gauge displays is indicating a failure, the circuits serving the instrument in question must be checked for clean, tight, unbroken and non-shorted connections.

important.para: Be sure all relays in the vehicle are the suppressed type.
Make sure the accessory voltage to the cluster is within a range of 11 to 16 volts.

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Isolation

svcsubproc.para: The instrument cluster performs a brief self-test when the key switch is turned ON that indicates whether the cluster is functioning properly.

note.para: Operation and accuracy of the speedometer and tachometer can be verified with an EST without removing the cluster. The Pro-Link 9000 with the Instrument Panel Cartridge Kit, or the EZ-Tech with the instrument cluster software can be used to exercise the speedometer/tachometer, through the J1708 data link . Refer to the Pro-Link or EZ-Tech instrument cluster software manual for instructions.

svcsubproc.para: The cluster will test itself each time the vehicle is powered up and indicates by pointer movement if the cluster is performing properly. The pointers should perform as follows:

item.para: The unit will drive both the speedometer and tachometer needles to the 9 o'clock position for about 2 seconds and return to the "0" position.
Both pointers will then advance through one complete smooth sweep and proceed back to the "0" position. This indicates that all output circuits are good and tells the driver that the gauges are good.

svcsubproc.para: The cluster will provide failure indications in two ways:

item.para: The speedometer and tachometer pointers do not move on power up.
The speedometer and tachometer pointers do not provide a proper gauge sweep or exhibit erratic pointer movement on power up.

svcsubproc.para:
If either of the above failures occurs, the speedo/tach cluster must be removed from the instrument panel and all connections to the vehicle wire harness disconnected for further testing. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL
.
Conditions and corrective action are defined in the Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Chart below.

table.title: Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Chart

entry.para: Condition
First Action
Second Action
1. Speedometer and tachometer needles do not move on power up test.
Remove cluster and verify ignition voltage and ground are provided to the cluster. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Replace cluster.
2. Speedometer or tachometer needle moves erratically or sweep is incomplete on power up test.

Perform Self Diagnostics Test
.
3. Speedometer pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through proper sweep when performing the Self Diagnostics Test.
Switch the speedometer and tachometer in the cluster. Rerun test. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.
4. Tachometer pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through proper sweep when performing the Self Diagnostics Test.
Switch the tachometer and speedometer in the cluster. Rerun test. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.

5. Odometer does not increment properly as described in Performing the Self Diagnostics Test, Step 2, B
.
Remove odometer from cluster. MOMENTARILY apply 12 volt DC power across odometer leads. If odometer increments with power applied, REPLACE the cluster.
If odometer does not increment, REPLACE the odometer.
6. Speedometer or tachometer does not work while driving.
Check speedometer or tachometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Go to next step.
7. Speedometer or tachometer does not work or operate inaccurately while driving.

Manually program the cluster by physically setting all DIP switches. Refer to PROGRAMMING
. Check operation. If condition is corrected, leave the DIP switch settings in the new positions.
Replace cluster.

note.para: Prior to performing the Self Diagnostics process:

step1.para:
Remove speedo/tach unit from instrument panel and disconnect all connections to vehicle wiring harness. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL
.

Write down all DIP switch positions on the speedo/tach unit. The positions will either be a "1" or "0" for each switch. There are two sets of ten switches in each set. Verify the positions are recorded correctly. Switch settings must be set back to the original positions when diagnostics is completed in order for the cluster to work properly.
Set all of the DIP switches to the "0" position.
Attach Cluster Test Harness SE4365 to the speedo/tach unit ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Attach Cluster Test Harness to Speedo/Tach Unit

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. CONNECT CLUSTER DATA LINK CONNECTOR TO MATING TEST HARNESS CONNECTOR
3. CONNECT CLUSTER TACHOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (HAS (1) FEMALE TERMINAL)
5. CONNECT CLUSTER SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (HAS (3) FEMALE TERMINALS)
7. CONNECT CLUSTER TWO-SPEED CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (MUST BE CONNECTED EVEN IF THE VEHICLE DOES NOT HAVE 2-SPEED AXLE)

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 to June 1994 - Performing the Self Diagnostics Test:

step1.para: IMMEDIATELY after inserting the POWER PLUG into the cigar lighter, depress the MOMENTARY SWITCH repeatedly (at least three times) as rapidly as possible (within one second).
If unit is not defective, the speedo/tach unit pointers should:

step2.para: Rotate in unison to the "0" position on the gauge face.
Both pointers will then rotate in unison up-scale in ten equal steps to full scale (85 mph/3500 rpm). The odometer will advance .1 mile for each of the ten steps.
Both pointers will then rotate in unison down-scale back to the "0" position.

step1.para:
If unit fails to perform as described in the Self Diagnostics Test, continue on with the Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Chart
.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, Tachometer or Hourmeter Display Failure

svcsubproc.para: If any of the speedometer, odometer, tachometer or hourmeter displays is indicating a failure, the circuits serving the instrument in question must be checked for clean, tight, unbroken and non-shorted connections.

important.para: Be sure all relays in the vehicle are the suppressed type.
Make sure the accessory voltage to the cluster is within a range of 11 to 16 volts.

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, Tachometer and Hourmeter Failure Isolation

svcsubproc.para: The instrument cluster has self-testing capabilities that will identify various failures in the electronic portions of the unit. The self testing diagnostics provide a strong indication of exactly what is wrong with the unit, without removing the cluster from the vehicle or spending a large amount of time troubleshooting.

note.para: Operation and accuracy of the speedometer, tachometer, fuel, oil pressure, water temperature and voltmeter can be verified with an EST without removing the cluster. The Pro-Link 9000 with the Instrument Panel Cartridge Kit, or the EZ-Tech with the instrument cluster software can be used to exercise the speedometer/tachometer, through the J1708 data link . Refer to the Pro-Link or EZ-Tech instrument cluster software manual for instructions.

svcsubproc.para: The cluster will test itself each time the vehicle is powered up. If all tests pass, the unit will drive both the speedometer and tachometer needles through one complete sweep. This indicates that all input circuits are good and tells the driver that all output circuits driving the gauges are good.
The cluster will provide failure indications in two ways:

item.para: Does not provide a proper gauge sweep on power up.
The speedometer and tachometer needles "wave" on power up.

svcsubproc.para: If the unit senses a circuit problem at power up, the speedometer and tachometer needles will simultaneously wave from 0 and one of the numbers on the speedometer and tachometer dial faces three times. The "bad" gauge will be parked at full scale and the other gauge will be operable.
Conditions and corrective action are defined in the Speedometer, Odometer, Tachometer and Hourmeter Failure Chart below.

table.title: Speedometer, Odometer, Tachometer and Hourmeter Failure Chart

entry.para: Condition
First Action
Second Action
1. Speedometer and tachometer needles do not move on power up.
Remove cluster and verify ignition voltage and ground are provided to cluster. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Replace cluster.
2. Speedometer or tachometer needle moves erratically on power up sweep.
Remove cluster and swap the speedometer and tachometer in the cluster. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.
3. Speedometer and tachometer needles sweep three times between 0 and 500 RPM and 0 and 14 MPH.
Speedometer input circuit failure. Replace the cluster.
4. Speedometer and tachometer needles sweep three times between 0 and 1000 RPM and 0 and 25 MPH.
Tachometer input circuit failure. Replace the cluster.
5. Speedometer and tachometer needles sweep three times between 0 and 1500 RPM and 0 and 38 MPH.

J1587/J1708 Data Link failure. Insure that the vehicle Data Link is not shorted or wired incorrectly. With the ignition on, voltage from Positive data link circuit to ground should be approximately 4 volts. Voltage from Negative data link circuit to ground should be approximately 1 volt. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAM MANUAL.
Verify data from the ECM by using an electronic service tool (EST), such as the EZ-Tech™ or Pro-Link® 9000, with the applicable engine software. If data is present replace cluster.
6. Speedometer and tachometer needles sweep three times between 0 and 2000 RPM and 0 and 50 MPH.
Mechanical odometer drive circuit failed. Replace cluster.
7. Speedometer and tachometer needles sweep three times between 0 and 2500 RPM and 0 and 65 MPH.
Mechanical odometer is disconnected, or the odometer circuit has an open. Insure odometer connector is properly seated to the printed wiring board connector.
Disconnect odometer connector. Momentarily connect 12VDC across odometer wires. If odometer advances, replace cluster. If odometer does not advance, replace odometer.
8. Speedometer or tachometer gauge pointer goes to the 6 o'clock position and sounds three long beeps.
Sensor fault is indicated. Use an EST to check for engine fault codes that relate to sensor defects.
9. Speedometer or tachometer gauge pointer makes less than full sweep but is not at 6 o'clock position.
Gauge circuit fault is indicated. Remove cluster and swap the speedometer and tachometer in the cluster. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.
10. Speedometer and tachometer go through a good power up sweep, but speedometer does not work when driving.
Check speedometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Go to Step 12.
11. Speedometer and tachometer go through a good power up sweep, but tachometer does not work when driving.
Check tachometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Go to Step 12.
12. Speedometer or tachometer does not work or operates inaccurately while driving.

Manually program the cluster by physically setting all DIP switches. Refer to PROGRAMMING
. Check operation. If condition is corrected, leave the DIP switch settings in the new positions.
Replace cluster.
13. Speedometer and tachometer go through a good power up sweep, but mechanical odometer does not work when driving.
Remove mechanical odometer and momentarily touch leads across battery voltage. If the odometer operates, replace the cluster.
Replace the odometer.
14. Speedometer and tachometer go through a good power up sweep, but digital odometer/hourmeter does not work when driving.
Verify odometer/hourmeter is plugged in securely to the module circuit board. Check for unswitched battery voltage at circuit 14G, terminal 9 of connector (421). Replace digital display unit.
Replace cluster.
15. Digital odometer/hourmeter has missing display segments or extra lighted display segments.
Replace digital display unit.
Replace cluster.
